headline: Tesla Engineering VP Lars Moravy Urges Ted Cruz-Led Senate Commerce Committee To Build Federal Self-Driving Framework: 'We Must Modernize…'
summary: Tesla Inc.'s (NASDAQ:TSLA) Engineering VP, Lars Moravy, has urged the U.S. Senate Commerce Committee, led by Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX), to establish a federal framework for autonomous vehicles in the U.S. Federal Framework In his opening remarks to the committee on Wednesday, Moravy urged the need for a federal framework for AVs in the U.S. "At Tesla, we believe autonomous vehicles are the future," Moravy said, adding that the vehicles presented an opportunity to improve safety and accessibility. Don

headline: Should Tesla’s AI and Robotaxis Pivot After Weaker 2025 Results Require Action From Tesla (TSLA) Investors?
summary: Tesla recently reported weaker 2025 results, with full-year revenue of US$94,827 million and net income of US$3,794 million, while accelerating a shift away from legacy models toward robotaxis, humanoid robots and large-scale US solar manufacturing. At the same time, Elon Musk’s broader empire is being reshaped through the SpaceX–xAI merger and early discussions about a possible tie-up with Tesla, raising questions about how intertwined AI, space infrastructure and energy could redefine...

headline: Ross Gerber Says Tesla Will Be 'Another Division' Of X Amid Ticker Symbol Speculation, SpaceX-xAI Merger
summary: Investor Ross Gerber, co-founder of investment firm Gerber Kawasaki, has opined that Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) would be a division of X in the future. Another Division Of X In a post on the social media platform X on Wednesday, Gerber weighed in on reports that the ‘X' ticker symbol has been available now that the United States Steel Corporation, which used the X symbol, has been acquired by Nippon Steel. "The X symbol has been taken by someone for the NYSE," Gerber said. He then added that soon,

headline: India-US trade deal gives tariff-free access to Harley bikes, no reprieve for Tesla
summary: By Shivangi Acharya NEW DELHI, Feb 7 (Reuters) - India will slash tariffs on high-end American cars to 30% from as high as 110% and eliminate ​duties on Harley-Davidson bikes under an interim trade pact, an official ‌said, but will not make concessions for electric vehicles, a move that pointedly leaves Tesla out. ‌and India moved closer to a trade pact after releasing an interim framework on Friday, days after President Donald Trump said duties on Indian exports would be cut to 18% from 50% in

headline: Tesla Recasts Future Around Optimus Robots AI And Rich Valuation
summary: Tesla (NasdaqGS:TSLA) is winding down production of its Model S and Model X vehicles to convert facilities for large scale Optimus humanoid robot manufacturing. The company is publicly repositioning itself from a primarily electric vehicle maker to an AI and robotics focused business. Speculation continues around a possible combination of Tesla, SpaceX, and xAI, which could reshape how these businesses operate and are funded. For investors, this shift reframes Tesla from an auto...

headline: Elon Musk Warns US Will '1,000%' Go Bankrupt Over Soaring Debt, Says 'Interest Payments On National Debt Exceed Military Budget'
summary: On Friday Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk issued a stark warning regarding the U.S. national debt, stating that America is on a path to bankruptcy. Musk emphasized the necessity of advancements in artificial intelligence and robotics to avert this financial crisis. In a recent podcast appearance, Musk declared, "We are 1,000% going to go bankrupt as a country and fail as a country, without AI and robots. The national debt is piling up like crazy." He underscored that without these technologica
